data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: rectangles. yes exactly.
Readability: hard
Examples: 02:46, 09:31, 11:02, 12:59

Overlay is a watchface made of three rectangles that tell the hours, ten minute increments and single minutes by their height. There are helping lines in the background and a scale on the right side. Each third marker is longer and the sixth one is even a bit longer. I avoided numbers on purpose to keep the abstract appearance of the display. The width of the rectangles defines how to read: the wider, the later. That's basically "left to right", how you normally read. The rectangles are transparent so they create new rectangles in the mutual overlay area and therefore a new little scientific looking artwork as time passes.

Design / Programming / Copyright Â© 2011, 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow

Thank you Nev Rawlins for your help!
data.title: Overlay RGB

data.description:
19 Sept: update for sdk 4 quick view. Also replaced all images, and a new (clay) settings page.

-----
This is a watchface developed to showcase the stunning digital artwork of Laurens Lapre - see the website link for full-size images.

The watchface, though simple in design,  will display 20 different background images, randomly changing each hour or minute.

There are also options to show/hide the date and battery level, and for bluetooth vibe and hourly vibe.  It supports 12 and 24 hour time.

The small black dot in the very middle is the bluetooth indicator.  It will disappear when bluetooth is lost.


Perlin noise is a random sequence generator producing a more natural, harmonic succession of numbers than that of the standard random()function. It was invented by Ken Perlin in the 1980s and has been used in graphical applications to generate procedural textures, shapes, terrains, and other seemingly organic forms.

latest_release.release_notes: sdk4

data.title: Perlin

data.description:
ChronoTwist Axis is a watchface with a gesture based chronograph, Pebble Health step counter and current weather condition/temperature. 
Instructions:
To initialize the chronograph, hold the watch facing up (watchface flat relative to the ground) until the twist symbol appears. Twist the watch so that it is facing away from you (~90 degrees from where you started) until you feel a brief vibration. When you are ready to start the chronograph, twist the watch back to the starting position (facing up) until you feel another brief vibration. At this point the chronograph and tachymeter will appear. 

To stop the chronograph, repeat the previous steps and the time will turn red to indicate the chronograph is stopped. The chronograph can be restarted using the same actions. 

To reset the chronograph, hold the watch facing up until the twist symbol appears. Twist the watch so that it is facing away from you (~90 degrees from where you started) until you feel a brief vibration. Next twist the watch so that it is facing directly downward (~180 degrees from where you started) until you feel a brief vibration. 

Credits: merred's taller, loved the 90 degree text dividing the hour and minute.

latest_release.release_notes:
Uses Pebble Health API for step counting (and removed timeline integration)
Lighter color for hour and minute fonts

data.title: ChronoTwist Axis

data.author: John Hammond

changelog.release_notes:
The "Berlin Clock", on your wrist!

From Wikipedia...

Telling the time based on the "set theory principle", the Mengenlehreuhr (Berlin Clock) consists of 24 lights which are divided into one circular blinking yellow light on top to denote the seconds, two top rows denoting the hours and two bottom rows denoting the minutes.

The clock is read from the top row to the bottom. The top row of four red fields denote five full hours each, alongside the second row, also of four red fields, which denote one full hour each, displaying the hour value in 24-hour format. The third row consists of eleven yellow-and-red fields, which denote five full minutes each (the red ones also denoting 15, 30 and 45 minutes past), and the bottom row has another four yellow fields, which mark one full minute each. The round yellow light on top blinks to denote even- (when lit) or odd-numbered (when unlit) seconds.

data.description:

Telling the time based on the "set theory principle", the Mengenlehreuhr (Berlin Clock) consists of 24 lights which are divided into one circular blinking light on top to denote the seconds, two top rows denoting the hours and two bottom rows denoting the minutes.

The clock is read from the top row to the bottom. The top row of four fields denote five full hours each, alongside the second row, also of four fields, which denote one full hour each, displaying the hour value in 24-hour format. The third row consists of eleven fields, which denote five full minutes each, and the bottom row has another four fields, which mark one full minute each. The round light on top blinks to denote even- (when lit) or odd-numbered (when unlit) seconds.

data.description:
A simple, easy binary watchface in a circuit design. 

- binary time 
- 12 or 24 hour timeformat
- show/hide the numbers 
- day/night (black/white, invert) 
- auto day/night switching 
- show BT connection 
- battery bar 
- hourly vibe 
- vibe if BT disconnects 

It's pretty easy to learn how to read a binary clock. Just add the small numbers. 

You can change the color with a Day and Night-Mode. In Auto mode, the colors change automatically.

latest_release.release_notes: add 24h format

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: big, skewed numbers.
Readability: easy
Examples: 04:36, 06:25, 08:47, 12:59

The Skew watchface series consists of the types Stream, Super and Spirit. 

In Stream the skewed numbers are connected at their corners and have a single color. They create a single,  interesting looking shape that has to be read top to bottom. 

In Super the numbers have different colours and the overlapping parallelogram shows the combination colour - a little design tweak for colour fans. 

In Spirit the differently coloured numbers moved closer and overlap more. So there are more combination colour areas that leave a maybe hard to read but not unreadyble display. May the spirits help you reading that little piece of art.

Design : Sam Jerichow Programming : Sam Jerichow
Copyright Â© 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Skew Stream C

data.description:
Minions are small, yellow pill-like creatures who have existed since the beginning of time. Now a super breed* invades Pebble Times.
The super heroes' bum shows the current hour, and an unique 'hand' (arrow or whatever) points to the minutes. (E.g.: times in first 3 pictures are 10:16AM, 8:09 and 5:16PM; remaining are concept drawings of some of the heroes). Heroes change on the hour.

* Green Arrow, Aquaman, Avatar Aang, Batman, Captain America, The Flash, Hulk, Spiderman, Superman and Thor.

(Beta) Trying out different backgrounds:
Day: 8am - 6:59pm, Night: 7pm - 7:59am.

Just for fun, enjoy =D

PS: The 'hands' are unique to each super hero, e.g. lightning bolt for Thor, etc... but it's gonna take time to squeeze all the pictures in. Most are done, except SpiderMinion & Captain Amerinion.

data.description:
Reborn from one of the most famous and earliest activity tracking watchfaces for the original Pebble, On11.

On11 Time monitors your physical activity 24/7. It tells you how many steps you took and how much time you spent on sitting, walking, jogging, and sleeping (viewable through a companion app, coming soon).

The orange bar is your progress toward your daily Step Goal, and the green bar is for your Active Time Goal. You can configure both goals in the watchface settings.

Live long and prosper. Enjoy a healthy life! ð

data.author: kamotswind

changelog.release_notes:
Fixed a few bugs with weather display, should now be more reliable and also display an error code when there is a problem fetching weather.

Weather error codes:
GPS? = Couldn't get location. You may need to turn on location services (Only "coarse" fix required, which may not need GPS radio)

NET? = Failed to connect to the weather API, check your wifi or cellular network connection.

API? = Error when requesting weather from the API. Please report this error to me.

ERR! = Unknown error. Please report this error to me. If needed I will add additional error codes once I find the problem.
Updated to SDK 3.8.2, looks much better on the original Pebbles. Pebble Time Round support coming soon!

New settings have been added to change the frequency of weather updates and to switch between Celsius or Fahrenheit temperature display. Also fixed a small bug with the weather update timing that may cause duplicate updates.
Fixed a bug that occasionally caused the temperature display to show 200 degrees. Also made some improvements to the code for efficiency which will hopefully improve battery life.
Improved the API responses by registering and using an API key. Processing of the return data still needs some tweaking. Also now has sun and moon icons which is intended by the OpenWeatherMap API.

Improved the weather update timing which should reduce the chance of receiving a "PHN?" error. Also added a new weather age display. The time displayed is based on the API's timestamp of how old the weather information is. This is not how long since the last weather update, which is still every 20 minutes.

This release fixes a few bugs in the weather code. On B&W Pebbles (aplite) the weather was sometimes not updating at all. This was due to a timing issue between when the request was sent from the watch and when the javascript was ready on the phone. This didn't affect color Pebbles (basalt). Even with the fix you may still encounter a "PHN?" error which should clear itself and display weather data within 60 seconds. There was also a problem that affected both platforms where a certain weather status wouldn't display any icon; this has also been fixed. I plan to do some additional work with the weather icons to improve the information displayed. Right now they match exactly what the API says to display, but I have noticed the API has additional information that would better be represented by a different icon.
Changed the way that weather updates are timed and triggered. Should be more reliable.
Increased weather update frequency to every 20 minutes.

Added weather display capabilities (off by default). Uses current location provided by phone and queries openweathermap.org for the weather. Currently only displays temperature in Fahrenheit. Refreshes every 30 minutes. Configuration options for refresh time and temperature format coming soon!
Added ability to change the digital display to Zulu (UTC) time instead of local time.

Added option to display a seconds hand (including custom color!). When enabled this may reduce battery life. Added by request for those in the medical field. Also added an icon to indicate when the watch is connected to power but not charging (usually when fully charged).

This version includes new capabilities to change the watchface "color" settings on the B&W Pebble. Also changed the way things load so when the configuration is changed the watchface will reload automatically.

This version has a new Bluetooth status display. When the display is enabled in the configuration interface, a Bluetooth symbol will appear just below the battery status display if the phone is connected. If the phone is not connected, nothing will be displayed. Also, this version increases the thickness of the clock border on B&W Pebbles.
Added ability to change how many hour markers are displayed.

The configuration window will now remember your settings so each time you go to change your configuration it will display the current configuration. This will only work after you save a new configuration with this new version (sorry).

Fixed issue with version number not writing to persistant storage which could cause default color issues for new users (issue 1 @ github). Changed the battery low and charging indicators so they work with any color scheme and actually show up on the original B&W Pebbles. The beginnings of some new features are in this version, but not visible or working yet.

Finally finished the color changing interface! I also added an app icon which should show up on the watch in the watchfaces menu. Also has code to convert past configuration versions so I can add more features in the future. I eventually need to figure out how to hide the color selection options and replace it with an "invert" toggle for anyone using the original B&W Pebble.

Added support for the original B&W Pebbles. Increased the font size of the digital time display. Made a small tweak to the battery status display so it is more visible at 10% while still maintaining a good ratio for at-a-glance read of the capacity remaining.

Configuration interface now works. The only option available right now is to toggle on the digital time display at the bottom (a feature request). The next release will include a color picker. You do need to leave the watchface and go back to it for the changes to take effect. A reminder to do this is on the configuration page.

data.description: This is a simple low battery utilization watchface with fully customizable colors, battery monitoring and toggle-able Bluetooth status display among other options. Also has a toggle-able weather display.

latest_release.release_notes:
Fixed a few bugs with weather display, should now be more reliable and also display an error code when there is a problem fetching weather.

Weather error codes:
GPS? = Couldn't get location. You may need to turn on location services (Only "coarse" fix required, which may not need GPS radio)

NET? = Failed to connect to the weather API, check your wifi or cellular network connection.

API? = Error when requesting weather from the API. Please report this error to me.

ERR! = Unknown error. Please report this error to me. If needed I will add additional error codes once I find the problem.

data.title: Kamots Time

data.author: hitormiss

data.description:
Introducing Duck Hunt GT!

Features include
-Temperature (requires free API Key from Openweathermap.org)
-Weather condition icons
-Bluetooth Disconnection Indicator
-Randomized characters each hour
-Background colors change depending on the time of day
-Background image for each season
-Battery Life indicator
-and Time

Shake your watch and...
-The date will display where the battery is for 5 seconds
-The weather status will refresh (normally automatic every 30 minutes)

Hope you enjoy this step into the past! And remember to plant a heart if you love it and be sure to show it off.

changelog.release_notes: - SDK 4 ready
- fixed temporary the limited Memory Problem

- Add Pebble Health support
- now you can show the walked distance of the day in miles and in kilometers
- more battery-safe in all modes
- fixed some minor bugs 

... thanks for all feedback!

- fixed the second-hand-bug ... thanks for all feedback and help!
- more battery-safe in all modes
- you can disable the markers
- you can disable the date
- i added the date-language Irish

- fixed some bugs
- more battery-safe
- you can config to see 12 / 3,6,9,12 or all numbers on wachface
- you can change the digital-time-format to 12H / 24H - i added the date-language Italian

- now you can show the Time as digital Numbers too
- you can change the colors of Date and Digital-Time

- fix a problem wirth the time-notification vibration
- optimize sthe stroke width of minute and hourhand
- update, fix a problem with the time-notification-vibration

- i've added the date-language Spain
- you can get a vibration if the bluetooth connection lost
- you can configure a vibration on every hour, half hour or 15 Minutes
- fixed som little bugs
now you can change the date-language to english, french or german

- now you can change the color of the Numbers
- second-hand color can set to similar color of the numbers
Now you can change the stroke of the Minute-Hand

Big update to v2.0 :)

Configuration-Page, now you can change:

- Marker Color
- Second-Hand Mode (hide, run, etc.)
- Second-Hand Color
- Hour-/Minute-Hand Color

Battery-indicater is now animate for charging

- battery indicator fixed

data.description:
TimeFace One is a configurable antialasing watchface for your pebble time including Pebble Health.

UPDATE to New Version v3.0  Enjoy it :-)
 
Thx for your Help and Feedback ... so i could fixed some bugs :-)

- SDK 4 ready

You can show the walked distance of the day in miles and in kilometers, so please enable/disable Pebble Health in our Configuration-Panel (last point) and have fun :-)
- more Power-Save in all Modes

Features:

- Configuration Panel
- shows the walked distance of the day in miles and in kilometers
- manage secound-hand-mode for saving battery life:
- hide secound-hand
- indicator for battery status
- indicator and vibration for bluetooth status
- language support: english / french / german / spanish / italian / irish
- shows Digital-Time in 12 / 24 hours
- shows Month and Day of the Year
- vibration every hour / half hour or fifteen minutes
- choose color of Markers, Numbers, Hands, Day and Month and Digital-Time
- choose Number-Mode to see only the 12 or 3,6,9,12 or all Numbers

If you see a bug or if you have an idea to make the watchface  better then feel free to contact me ...

...and please don't forget to tap the heart if you like :)

latest_release.release_notes: - SDK 4 ready

data.description:
A colour version of my popular face for classic pebble: Traditional Japanese.

You get to set the colour, here's how:
Install the watch-face
In the settings for the face on the phone select a text colour and a background colour then press enter.

It's that simple!

Description from B&W version:

Want to practice your kanji? This is the watch-face for you.
Features 11 characters.

Why it's interesting:
The Japanese number system is similar to the Latin in that it is in base 10, the symbols themselves are different and 10 is represented by 1 character.

For example:
10 = å
40 = åå
15 = åäº
45 = åäº

This watch-face is based off big time so it is read left -> right, top -> bottom.
If you want to change this to be the traditional orientation, you can do so on the configuration webpage.

latest_release.release_notes: New font

data.description:
Cyclops uses colors to show the time.

3 watchfaces in one: 

âCyclopsâ mode - looking like a eye, with three areas color-coded to represent numbers.  Outer ring for hours, next ring in for 10-minutes, middle for single minutes.  The code is mostly derived from rainbow colors âRed, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violetâ (red starting at 1).  0 is light green, 8 light gray, 9 light blue and, for 10-hours, the 1 is dark blue.  

âUp-downâ mode - "up" for hours, "down" for minutes - left for 10-minutes, right for single minutes.  Same color code used.

"Count" mode - count dark gray blocks in the 4 quadrants.

A cheat option is activated by shaking the watch: shows digits in text - helpful when learning.   Shake again to make it disappear.   Can be disabled in settings.

An animation every 15 minutes can also be disabled.

First screenshot animation shows the transition from 03:14 to 03:15 in "Cyclops" mode.

Other screenshots:  
(2)   7:13  "Cyclops" mode (cheat display)
(3)   7:13  "Up-Down" mode
(4)   7:14  "Count" mode
(5) 12:47  "Cyclops" mode

Design created by Dietrich Faust and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.  It is produced with the designer's permission and sanctioned by Tokyoflash. 

The original design can be found here:  
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/06/11/cyclops-colour-coded-watch-design/

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Quick Views

data.author: Freakified

changelog.release_notes:
v7.1
* Oops left in a debug line that broke the config page. Fixed now.

Version 7.0 ("The Apocalypse Update")
	â¢ Support for Time 2, so that when you pay $2000 for a prototype Time 2 on Ebay you'll be able to run TimeStyle on it
	â¢ Added option to hide the Bluetooth disconnection icon, for when the Pebble app is but a distant memory
		â (Thanks to plarusÂ on GitHub for this contribution!)
	â¢ Fixed visual glitch when LECO is selected and leading zero is hidden
	â¢ Added the Hebrew language (language pack required) so that you'll be able to converse with the four horsemen of the apocalypse

v6.11
 - Vibration settings now respect watch quiet time setting

v6.10
 â¢ Removed sleep function temporarily, until Pebble gets their act together and fixes the sleep bug
 â¢ Add Korean language
 â¢ Fixes that allow building on latest SDK

v6.9:
 	â¢ New language option: æ¥æ¬èª (Japanese, requires language pack)
	â¢ New sidebar widget: heart rate monitor (for Pebble 2 only)
	â¢ Improved LECO font metrics to better match "classic" appearance
	â¢ Fixed a bug where antialiasing would fail to re-enable when changing fonts
	â¢ Fixed a bug where certain combinations of widgets would overlap in Quick View mode

v6.8
 - Fixed an issue where the center widget wouldn't display if large fonts were enabled

v6.7
* Slight fix for off-center time on round watches

v6.6
- At last! Timeline Peek support!
- Improved font metrics for round watches
- Sidebar now defaults to grey on black and white watches
- Menu icon no longer has white corners on black and white watches

v6.5 "The calm before the storm"
- Preliminary support for the Pebble 2
- Added Gallacian language

v6.4
 * Fixed issue from 6.3 update that broke GPS weather

v6.3
 * Fixed issue where Weather Underground wouldn't work for certain locations

v6.2
 - Fixed an issue where only "day" weather icons were shown if Weather Underground was used

v6.1
 - Fix for potential issue where weather updates could become erroneously disabled

â¢ New! Alternative weather data source
		â Want more accurate weather data? Now you can choose Weather Underground, as long as you provide an API key!
	â¢ Fixed a bug where OWM forecasts often had the same high and low temperature
	â¢ Hourly vibe is now a double pulse, to distinguish it from notifications
	â¢ Battery now shows "5%" instead of "0%" when at lowest level, to match official battery meter appearance
	â¢ Percent sign now shows to the left of the number when language is set to Turkish
Month of "May" now fits slightly better in the sidebar

v5.13
 - Fix for an issue where the weather failed to update (thanks, IguanaBen!)

v5.12
 - Restored weather forecast functionality via dark magickry

v5.11:
	â¢ EMERGENCY WEATHER FIX: switched to OpenWeatherMap since Yahoo is finally dead for real
		â Note: The weather forecast widget has been temporarily removed. It will return, in some form, in the future (OWM doesn't offer daily forecasts)
	â¢ New default widgets since weather is evil
		â Health on Time-series watches
		â Battery with percentage on BW watches
	â¢ Watchface loads and exits much faster, thanks to optimizations from tsymbaliuk!
	â¢ Automatic battery indication threshold lowered to 10%
	â¢ Health widget now respects global unit setting
New language: Welsh

v5.10 - now with blatant disregard for decimal numbering systems
 - Ukranian language option (contributed by tsymbaliuk!)
 - Potential fix: parts of the sidebar should no longer disappear on round watches after receiving notifications (thanks to ygalanter for the code)
 - Potential fix: weather forecast icon should no longer disappear on BW pebbles
 - Day and month names no longer bump up against the edges of the sidebars on round watches

v5.9
 - Fixed issue where step distances between 100m and 999m didn't show up
 - Added new user-contributed themes

v5.8
 - Health now uses small font when showing distance above 10 kilometers
 - Battery levels less than 20% now display properly on BW watches w/ black sidebar

data.description:
Digital. Readable. Completely customizable.

Now with fitness data!

The Timeline handles the past and the futureâlet TimeStyle handle your present.

â¢ Time you can see. Even in the dark.
With more than 80% of the display devoted to the time and 6 font options, TimeStyle lets you read the time in even the most adverse conditions.

â¢ Matches today's wardrobe. And tomorrow's.
With thousands of color scheme possibilities, you'll always be color coordinated.

â¢ The information you care about, and none that you don't.
TimeStyle features a wide variety of different complications, including step counts, sleep times, weather, the week number, seconds, the time in another time zone, the battery level, Swatch Internet Time (beats), and more!

â¢ Know your status.
TimeStyle automatically displays notifications when the battery is low or when your phone disconnects.

â¢ Speaks your language: With 35 languages, TimeStyle supports more languages than ANY other watchface. Choose between English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Turkish, Czech, Slovak, Portuguese, Greek, Swedish, Polish, Romanian, Vietnamese, Catalan, Norwegian, Russian, Estonian, Basque, Finnish, Danish, Lithuanian, Slovenian, Hungarian, Croatian, Serbian, Irish, Latvian, Chinese, Japanese, Indonesian, Ukrainian, Welsh, and Gallacian! (Your language missing? Contact me and I'll add it!)

latest_release.release_notes:
v7.1
* Oops left in a debug line that broke the config page. Fixed now.

SimpleTime has been changed to "Simplicity Time".

v2r2 (ver2.1) includes the following changes:

data.description:
Simple Time brings simplicity back to a clock. It tells you the time in big, bold lettering, and it also displays today's date in two different easy-to-read formats. It also brings some color into your life.

Simple Time is designed to be a casual watch face that's easy to glance at with minimal effort just to read the time. It also allows, if you look a little closer, the reader to get some more details about the time and date. For the Pebble Time, it also adds a little splash of color to your day.

changelog.release_notes: Animation got a bit truer to the actual game: Q*bert now has four perspectives depending on his walking direction.

The small playfield shows 12 outer tiles, each of which corresponds to a full hour. The little red ball is the hour finger. The snake shows the minutes, however, only a multiple of 5. Read the missing minutes from the four inner tiles. Qbert jumps every 5 seconds and the disk appears only for PM.

data.description:
Q*Bert is a popular 80ies 8-bit vintage game. The familiar playfield allows to read the clock to a precision of +/- 5 seconds. Find out how (the screenshot reads 7:13:45 PM).

If Q*Bert won your heart - don't hesitate :)

data.description:
No frills or fancy design - just the essentials in a readable font.
ZuluFace provides the time in a font big enough for the over-40s to read without glasses, plus UTC time. And the current day and date. Battery and Bluetooth status are also there. It vibrates if you lose Bluetooth connectivity - so you can go back and retrieve your phone. What more do you need in a watchface?

latest_release.release_notes: Fix UTC problem with original Pebble; fix Bluetooth status image for original Pebble.

data.title: ZuluFace

data.title: segcirc

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: two cryptic segmented columns
Readability: impossible at first, medium after training
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

I played once more with digits that got stolen the center segments and thought about emphasizing the void on the "hardware" level of the watch face design. This is how the two columns of lights were made. Please check the number explanation in the preview section!

At first those light columns are seen as single information units but the way to read the watch is across the center gap which nobody will know when you show them the display. 

I let the lights seem to originate from the lateral display edges, getting stronger on the and then suddenly stop. This bilateral design reminded me of a capacitor, and so the name was born. 

The Capacitor watch face is for fans of science fiction as well as science fact. 

Design / Programming / Copyright Â© 2014, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Capacitor R

data.author: Serge
data.description:
Watch face with steps and activity monitor inspired by Garmin and 91 DUB V3.0. Shows your daily goal, steps counter and inactive minutes. 
Top activity bar will be filled in an hour of inactivity and will vibrate every 15 minutes until you get up and walk for a couple of minutes. 
The smiling face indicates your long-term statistics of your daily goal achievement. More than 80% makes it happy and less than 40% not.
Daily goal, starting from 8.25K steps, will increase 5% when you achieve it or get 5% less otherwise.
Step counting is quite accurate (well, at least in tracking walking steps :), but sometimes it fails to count real steps. Steady pace walking gives almost 100% accuracy, but a 30-min drive can count about 30-100 extra steps.
There's an issue with horizontal movement (ellipse trainer, for example) that counts almost no steps.
data.title: MoveIt!

data.title: MGT

data.author: svlentink
data.description:
Navigation watchface for the Netherlands.
This app uses the api from 9292.nl.
It uses the location from your phone as starting location and your defined destination as finish.

How it works.
You specify what your destinations are and it shows the bus, train, ferry or metro you have to take to get there.
E.g. on workdays in the morning, it should route you to work and the remaining time it should route you home.
This personal schedule for locations and time frames is set on the settings page.

The GUI of this watchface is not its strongest, e.g. the B stands for bus, the W stands for walk etc. Please support this project on Github.
data.title: 9292 ov

data.author: Justin K Mai

changelog.release_notes: Chess match now updates properly on 24h clock style
Initial Release

data.description: Known as 'The Evergreen Game', watch as this famous chess match between Adolf Anderssen and Jean Dufresne unfolds right on your wrist throughout your day. The chess match resets at midnight and a move is made every half hour. Only time will tell if Jean Dufresne learns from his mistakes, or if he is destined to lose until the end of time.

latest_release.release_notes: Chess match now updates properly on 24h clock style

data.description:
Digital watchface with stripe background.

On the settings page, you can control the number & color of the stripes, direction & frequency of rotation (or make the stripes static), and the color and outline of the time.

Feedback and suggestions are welcome
